abstract: NFL Roundup; NFL reports that 202 concussions were diagnosed during 2014 preseason and regular season, an 11.8 percent drop from 2013; cites new, stricter rules on helmet-to-helmet tackles; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: The league said that 202 concussions were diagnosed in the preseason and regular season in practices as well as games, down from 229 last season.
snippet: The league said that 202 concussions were diagnosed in the preseason and regular season in practices as well as games, down from 229 last season.
